newsitem.title: USA: IQ "not uncomfortable" with Q1 estimate.
newsitem.headline: IQ "not uncomfortable" with Q1 estimate.

text.p: IQ Software Corp's controller said Tuesday he was "not uncomfortable" with Wall Street's earnings per share estimates for IQ, which range from $0.08 to $0.13 for the first quarter, ending April 30.
"We are not uncomfortable with that," Kent Elmer, told Reuters at the annual Robinson-Humphrey institutional conference.
IQ posted first quarter net income per share of $0.13 a year ago.
Elmer said the business software supplier had no reason to "discredit" analysts' consensus earnings estimate of $0.69 per share for the fiscal year ending next January.
In the previous fiscal year the company earned $0.45 per share.
